meanings.definition: left in a difficult or helpless position
meanings.sent1: The stranded puppy looked lost and scared in the park.
meanings.sent2: The shipwrecked sailors were stranded on the deserted island.
meanings.sent3: The stranded kitten tried to climb a tree but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her car broke down in the middle of nowhere, leaving her stranded.
meanings.sent5: The stranded hiker had no phone signal to call for help.

meanings.definition: having come to rest on a shore or bank
meanings.sent1: The stranded boat gently rocked in the calm waters.
meanings.sent2: The seagulls gathered around the stranded fish on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The stranded seashell was picked up by a curious child.
meanings.sent4: The stranded driftwood created a beautiful pattern on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The stranded crab scuttled back to the ocean as the tide came in.

meanings.definition: stopped or delayed in a journey
meanings.sent1: The stranded bus passengers waited patiently for the mechanic.
meanings.sent2: The stranded train was finally able to continue its journey after repairs.
meanings.sent3: The stranded delivery truck caused a traffic jam on the highway.
meanings.sent4: The stranded flight passengers were offered vouchers for the inconvenience.
meanings.sent5: The stranded cyclist fixed a flat tire before continuing the ride.
